I know that we are on "shelter in place," but if you are out taking care of other essentials, this might be for you:

It's time to couple COVID closing with Spring Cleaning!! If you and your family are searching for something to do, there are two bins of jigsaw puzzles in front of the high school Feel free to stop in and take one to do. When you are finished, you can either return it and exchange, or pass it on to a neighbor. If you have puzzles that you would not mind sharing, drop them off as well, for others to use. You could even offer to do the same at your home or some other location, and extend the idea to books, family board games, and anything else that might help another family get through these times. Be ready for others to share the idea and swap books and games rather than just taking them.

The puzzles out front do not need to come back, and I honestly won't guarantee that all of the pieces are there, but feel free to share. Hope this helps!

Congratulations to all of our student-athletes who competed at the USA Clay Target League National Championship in Michigan. Our team placed 89th out of 206 teams on the opening day Friday, July 12th (needed to be in top 80 for team to advance to Saturday's competition).
Huge shout out to Grant Schmidt who was one of only 5 competitors to shoot a perfect 100/100 on Friday!!!
Connor Thompson joined Grant making the finals as an individual. Connor's overall score was a 183/200, placing him 362 out of 1700 kids.
Grant shot 194/200, placing him 65th out of 1700 participants. Only 5 kids from Illinois shot higher than him, and locally Grant scored the best!
Another great showing for our trap team in its second year of competing. BIG thank you to Don Williamson for spear heading this endeavor giving our young people the opportunity to showcase their talents, and to Ms. Zimmer who acted as the sponsor for this group.

Altamont District #10 is considering a change to the athletic colors of our teams. Currently, we are Red and White for our junior high school teams and Orange and Black for our high school teams. In previous discussions, we have learned that there are traditions that dictate aspects of our athletics, and we have no desire to make a change that would detract from such history. However, we also see the sense in unifying our public school colors to enhance and deepen our athletics tradition. To achieve this, we are proposing becoming Orange and Black throughout our K-12 public school system. This change would be gradual to make additional costs to the district minimal.

We would like to have your input. Please take a moment to answer the questions below so we can ensure that any change will be for the best. Feel free to contact the high school with any questions via email to Peggy Bueker (pbueker@altamontschools.org).

This form will close on July 9th at midnight.
